column4: is there a way to edit the bootloader if grub won't boot into any OS? i'm really in a pickle :(
2nd url :)
are you getting some sort of error message?
one moment
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=77042 and http://wiki.linuxquestions.org/wiki/GRUB#Error_18 explain what it means
did this error happen the first time you booted up ubuntu or did it work before?
i got this after installing
the confusing thing about this message is that my machine isn't that old, and it booted off a pretty large windows partition without a problem
perhaps it has to do with the way that you partitioned it. is windows on the first primary partition?
yep. windows is on disk1, first partition, and this is the boot partition. ubuntu is on disk0, at the end of the physical disk
okay, there seems to be some translation error :)  how many *physical* hard drives do you have installed? 1 or 2?
i have two
aaaah.... so you installed windows on the first one (disk0) and ubuntu on the second one (disk1)?
mostly correct- for some reason, windows calls the physical disk with ubuntu on it "disk0", even though "disk1" is the physical disk that has the MBR
that's a bit... confusing, indeed. are they IDE or SATA?

they are SATA. i have two partitions on each disk, and disk0 was the only one that had enough room for a new linux partition :/ do i need to have ubuntu on the same physical disk as the MBR? or more specifically, does the "/boot" partition need to be on the same physical disk as the MBR?
yeah, grub should only be on the ubuntu system, and you should be able to change the boot sequence from the BIOS, and grub should pick up windows and make it a selection
er, only on the ubuntu disk
i would just boot from the livecd and tell grub to install to the MBR of disk1 (/dev/sdb?), then reboot and tell bios to boot HDD-1 before booting HDD-0
theoretically, you should still be able to boot into windows (if it's XP... if it's Vista, not sure..) and fix the MBR of disk0 from there
unfortunately my install CD is also botched :| so i'm downloading another one... we'll see how it goes :) but i'll try that
okay :)
